image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Deadly Israeli airstrike in Beirut kills 37
item.description: An Israeli airstrike in a Beirut suburb killed at least 37 people, including senior Hezbollah leaders. The attack targeted an underground meeting of Hezbollah commanders, resulting in significant casualties and damage. This escalation has heightened cross-border violence and diplomatic tensions, prompting Lebanon's Prime Minister to cancel his planned UN visit.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Trump made Robinson...': Harris' campaign aims to shift voters in NC amid scandal
item.description: Kamala Harris' campaign is seizing the scandal surrounding North Carolina gubernatorial candidate Mark Robinson to win over Black and suburban voters. By focusing on Robinson's controversial remarks and his connection with Trump, Harris' team aims to influence voter sentiment in this key swing state, seeing it as a significant opportunity for the next election.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: French President Emmanuel Macron appoints new govt in shift to right
Europe needs to be tough on migrants: Danish PM Mette Frederiksen
Zelenskyy hopes for quick US action as more arms depots hit in Russia
As drought threat grows, a 'dead tree' emoji is coming
US national security adviser Jake Sullivan expresses worry over escalating tension in Middle East
Hungarian intel agency interviews CEO with pager link
Weaponising ordinary devices violates international law: UNHR chief
Kamala Harris accepts CNN invite for second presidential debate
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump are scheduled for a second presidential debate on October 23, organized by CNN. Harris's campaign stressed the significance of another debate for voters' assessment. The format mirrors their previous encounter, which Trump commended. The Trump campaign has not yet issued a response.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Mark Robinson's lewd comments removed after CNN report
item.description: Mark Robinson, the Republican candidate for North Carolina governor, faces criticism following a CNN report uncovering offensive comments he made on a pornographic website. Although there are calls for him to withdraw from the race against Democrat Josh Stein, he remains on the ballot. The issue has garnered attention from both Trump and Harris.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why is Cards Against Humanity suing Elon Musk's SpaceX?
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 18-year-old woman arrested after crushing man under wheels of his own Porsche, see video
item.description: An 18-year-old Canadian woman named Sarah Badshaw has been arrested for stealing a Porsche and injuring its owner in Mississauga. Captured on a doorbell camera, she faces charges like dangerous operation causing bodily harm and theft. The stolen vehicle was later found abandoned in the same area.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 10 disturbing comments made by 'Black Nazi' Mark Robinson
item.description: Mark Robinson, North Carolina’s Lieutenant Governor and Republican gubernatorial candidate, is facing backlash over controversial comments made on a pornography website years ago. His remarks include identifying as a 'black NAZI,' advocating for slavery, using derogatory language towards multiple communities, and displaying hypocrisy regarding abortion. These revelations cast doubt on his suitability for office.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Two dead, three hurt after a shooting in downtown Minneapolis
item.description: Early Saturday, a shooting in downtown Minneapolis left two men dead and three others injured, including two teenage girls. The violence erupted from a fight between groups of people. One person was arrested on suspicion of inciting a riot. Authorities plan to increase patrols in collaboration with local law enforcement agencies.

item.title: Court gives 5 days for X to validate its Brazil legal representative
item.description: The Brazilian Supreme Court has mandated Elon Musk's social platform X to submit documents within five days validating its newly appointed legal representative in Brazil. This comes after the court ordered a block on X for failing to comply with local laws, including appointing a legal representative, following the closure of its offices and dismissal of staff.

item.title: Trump to visit North Carolina amid Mark Robinson scandal
item.description: Donald Trump will visit North Carolina without Republican gubernatorial candidate Mark Robinson, who faces allegations of making controversial remarks. Despite denying these claims, some Republicans worry that Robinson's candidacy could impact Trump's chances in the battleground state. Democrats are capitalizing on this controversy by linking Trump to Robinson in their campaign ads.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Allegations against Al Fayed didn't come as 'biggest surprise': former manager says staff aware about owner’s interest in ‘young, blond girls'
item.description: Gaute Haugenes, former Fulham manager, disclosed that female players were safeguarded from the club’s late owner Mohamed Al Fayed due to his interest in young, blond girls. A BBC documentary unveiled multiple allegations of assault and rape against Fayed by ex-Harrods employees. Fulham is currently investigating if any staff members were affected.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 5.3 magnitude earthquake strikes Taiwan's east coast
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: China's 'beautiful governor' infamous for having multiple affairs with subordinates, arrested
item.description: Zhong Yang, ex-governor of Qiannan prefecture in Guizhou province, was sentenced to 13 years in prison and fined one million Yuan for misconduct. She accepted nearly 60 million yuan in bribes and engaged in inappropriate relationships with 58 subordinates. Zhong has been expelled from the Communist Party and stripped of her roles.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
